nodes.bodyText:
We have race condition here.
Timeline:

we initialize watchDog and call subscribe
watch dog run new thread, read ZK and call handle()
zkStateTracker still and handle() fails because of NPE
We initialize zkStateTracker in main thread

maybe we should set empty state before START? It could be race condition.

script sends signal START
FL receives this signal, handles it and sets state to 0
scrips sets state to ""
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -15,5 +15,14 @@ done
 
 # add default zkNode
 /opt/zookeeper/bin/zkCli.sh -server 127.0.0.1:2181 create /${KILDA_ZKNODE} ""
-
+/opt/zookeeper/bin/zkCli.sh -server 127.0.0.1:2181 create /${KILDA_ZKNODE}/floodlight ""
+/opt/zookeeper/bin/zkCli.sh -server 127.0.0.1:2181 create /${KILDA_ZKNODE}/floodlight/1 ""
+/opt/zookeeper/bin/zkCli.sh -server 127.0.0.1:2181 create /${KILDA_ZKNODE}/floodlight/1/signal "START"
+/opt/zookeeper/bin/zkCli.sh -server 127.0.0.1:2181 create /${KILDA_ZKNODE}/floodlight/1/state ""

nodes.bodyText: I believe it should be final.
This one should be final too.
Please, consider a one of existing retry solution which support delays / backing off. E.g. FailSafe

why each attempt is error but final message "we failed to connect" is warn?
Maybe attempts  should be warn and final message is error. Or even both should be error
we want to add force read after connection. Are we sure that 10 attempts is enough? I don't know how may retries we need. But in Interceptors we have infinite retries
